rocketuc
Class ROCKETuC

java.lang.Object
  rocketuc.ROCKETuC

public class ROCKETuC
extends Object

Main ROCKETuC class

+Example
import rocketuc.*;

ROCKETuC launchpad;

char led;
char button;

void setup() {
  println(ROCKETuC.list());
  launchpad = new ROCKETuC(this, ROCKETuC.list()[0], 9600, "launchpad");

  led = launchpad.getPin("P1.3");
  button = launchpad.getPin("P1.4");
  launchpad.pinMode(led, ROCKETuC.OUTPUT);
  launchpad.pinMode(button, ROCKETuC.PULLUP);
}

void draw() {

  if (launchpad.digitalRead(button) == 0)
  {
    background(random(0, 255), random(0, 255), random(0, 255));
    fill(0, 255, 0);
    ellipse (50, 50, 50, 50);
  }
  else
  {
    fill(255, 0, 0);
    ellipse (50, 50, 50, 50);
  }

  if (mousePressed)
  {
    launchpad.digitalWrite(led, ROCKETuC.HIGH);
  }
  else
  {
    launchpad.digitalWrite(led, ROCKETuC.LOW);
  }
}

 class ROCKETuC.SerialProxy
          We need a class descended from PApplet so that we can override the serialEvent() method to capture serial data.

Constructor Detail

ROCKETuC

public ROCKETuC(PApplet myParent,
                String iname,
                String idevice)
Create a proxy to a uC running the ROCKETuC firmware at the default baud rate of 9600.

Parameters:
myParent - the Processing sketch creating this ROCKETuC board (i.e. "this").
iname - the name of the serial device associated with the ROCKETuC board (e.g. one the elements of the array returned by ROCKETuC.list())

ROCKETuC

public ROCKETuC(PApplet myParent,
                String iname,
                int irate,
                String idevice)
Create a proxy to uC board running the ROCKETuC firmware.

Parameters:
myParent - the Processing sketch creating this ROCKETuC board (i.e. "this").
iname - the name of the serial device associated with the uC (e.g. one the elements of the array returned by ROCKETuC.list())
irate - the baud rate to use to communicate with the ROCKETuC board (the ROCKETuC library defaults to 9600, and the examples use this rate, but other firmwares may override it)
Method Detail

dispose

public void dispose()

list

public static String[] list()
Get a list of the available uC's; currently all serial devices (i.e. the same as Serial.list()). In theory, this should figure out what's an uC and what's not.

pinMode

public void pinMode(char pin,
                    char mode)
Set a digital pin to input or output mode. Also sets pull-ups if present

Parameters:
pin - the pin whose mode to set
mode - either input(with options) or output

pwmPeriod

public void pwmPeriod(char pin,
                      int period)
Setup PWM period Also sets pull-ups if present

Parameters:
pin - the pin whose mode to set
PWM - period in milliseconds

pwmDuty

public void pwmDuty(char pin,
                    char duty)
Setup PWM duty cycle Also sets pull-ups if present

Parameters:
pin - the pin whose mode to set
PWM - duty cycle 0-255 is 0-100%

digitalWrite

public void digitalWrite(char pin,
                         char value)
Write to a digital pin (the pin must have been put into output mode with pinMode()).

Parameters:
pin - the pin to write to
value - the value to write: ROCKETuC.LOW or ROCKETuC.HIGH
